@grace1, Burn each level to one disk. Then open Rosetta Stone and insert the disk shortly after. Click add language, and then install the disk. Sorry for any misunderstandings. I'm testing it now.

I have just tested it, and It works. I burned the files onto a disk of appropriate size and opened Rosetta Stone. Then, I inserted the disk and waited a few seconds and waited to add language or you can click the second button at the top right and click Add or Remove Languages. Select add language, enter disk and click continue. Windows 7 x64 Tested.

For all those who are confused:

Just use PowerIso to mount each Spanish level to an unused drive, open the Rosetta Stone program and search for the language level.  It will find the language level and install it, adding the program data into a folder named content.  Then just unmount the Spanish level, mount the next level, and repeat.
